i1.name: Friend of the Forest
description: {{sbc|Innate:}} '''Ivern''' cannot attack nor damage non-epic {{tip|monster|monsters}}. Instead, targeting a jungle camp initiates a {{fd|2.5}} seconds {{tip|channel}} that, upon completion, places the monsters within a {{as|grove|buzzword2}}. Placing a {{as|grove|buzzword2}} costs {{sti|health|{{as|{{pp|(23.5-x)/100*({{ccd|Ivern|hp_base}}+{{ccd|Ivern|hp_lvl}}*(x-1)*(0.7025+0.0175*(x-1)))|formula = (23.5% - 1% per level) of base health}} health}}}} and {{sti|mana|{{as|{{pp|(34.5-1.5*x)/100*({{ccd|Ivern|mp_base}}+{{ccd|Ivern|mp_lvl}}*(x-1)*(0.7025+0.0175*(x-1)))|formula = (34.5% - 1.5% per level) of base mana}} mana}}}}, and cannot be placed if '''Ivern''' lacks the amount of resources. The channel cannot be cancelled in the first {{fd|0.15}} seconds and in the last {{fd|0.5}} seconds.

The {{as|grove|buzzword2}} matures over {{pp|40;38;36;34;32;30;27;24;21;18;15;11;7;3;1|formula = 42 - 2 per level until level 6, then 3 until level 11, then 4 until level 15. ''This is capped at 1 second at level 15.''}} seconds. When fully matured, '''Ivern''' can interact with the camp again to ''free'' the monsters after a {{fd|0.5}}-second [[Channel#Casting Times|cast time]], sending them away while receiving their {{tt|{{g|full gold}} and {{sti|experience|{{as|full experience}}}}|Not full when freeing Krug camp, see notes}} [[bounty|bounties]]. {{si|Smite|Smiting}} a large monster within a {{as|grove|buzzword2}} will instantly ''free'' the camp's monsters, regardless of its maturity or the monsters' {{as|'''current''' health}}.

If the camp's large monster has already been slain, '''Ivern''' will ''free'' the camp upon completing the channel at no cost. Similarly, the {{as|grove|buzzword2}} will instantly mature if the large monster is slain.

Starting at level 5, freeing the {{ui|Red Brambleback}} or the {{ui|Blue Sentinel}} leaves behind a ''sapling'' for 1 minute that can be picked up by an allied champion to gain the camp's buff, consuming it in the process. If at least one allied [[champion]] is nearby, '''Ivern''' can pick up the ''sapling'' to transfer it to the nearest one in range. If an ally kills either monster, they also leave behind a ''sapling'' that only '''Ivern''' can consume.
i1.descriptionHtml:
Innate: Ivern cannot attack nor damage non-epic monsters. Instead, targeting a jungle camp initiates a 2.5 seconds channel that, upon completion, places the monsters within a grove. Placing a grove costs (23.5-x)/100*(Unknown value: ccd Ivern hp_base+Unknown value: ccd Ivern hp_lvl*(x-1)*(0.7025+0.0175*(x-1)))undefined − (based on level) health and (34.5-1.5*x)/100*(Unknown value: ccd Ivern mp_base+Unknown value: ccd Ivern mp_lvl*(x-1)*(0.7025+0.0175*(x-1)))undefined − (based on level) mana, and cannot be placed if Ivern lacks the amount of resources. The channel cannot be cancelled in the first 0.15 seconds and in the last 0.5 seconds.
The grove matures over 40;38;36;34;32;30;27;24;21;18;15;11;7;3;1undefined − (based on level) seconds. When fully matured, Ivern can interact with the camp again to free the monsters after a 0.5-second Channel#Casting Times, sending them away while receiving their full gold and full experience bounty. Smite a large monster within a grove will instantly free the camp's monsters, regardless of its maturity or the monsters' current health.
If the camp's large monster has already been slain, Ivern will free the camp upon completing the channel at no cost. Similarly, the grove will instantly mature if the large monster is slain.
Starting at level 5, freeing the Red Brambleback or the Blue Sentinel leaves behind a sapling for 1 minute that can be picked up by an allied champion to gain the camp's buff, consuming it in the process. If at least one allied champion is nearby, Ivern can pick up the sapling to transfer it to the nearest one in range. If an ally kills either monster, they also leave behind a sapling that only Ivern can consume.
i1.notes:
* Freeing a {{tip|Krugs}} camp will only give the {{g|gold}} and {{sti|experience|{{as|experience}}}} of the present ''Krugs'', i.e the {{ui|Ancient Krug}} and a ''Medium'' {{ui|Krug}}, for a total of {{sti|experience|{{pp|(55+15)*(1+0.25*(x^3-x)/60)|1 to 7 for 4|type=monster's level|changedisplay=true|formula=''This is capped at monster's level 7.''|color=experience}} experience}} instead of {{pp|55+15+15*2+10*6; 55+15+15*2+10*6; (55+15)*1.025+15*2+10*6; (55+15+15*2+10*6)*1.025; (55+15)*1.1+(15*2+10*6)*1.025; (55+15+15*2+10*6)*1.1; (55+15)*1.25+(15*2+10*6)*1.1; (55+15+15*2+10*6)*1.25|type=monster's level|formula=''This is capped at monster's level 7, but effectively capped at level 8 because of additional krugs spawning with one less level.''|color=experience}}, and {{g|75 gold}} instead of {{g|125}}.
* ''Friend of the Forest'' can be used while '''Ivern''' or the camp is in combat and, once the {{as|grove|buzzword2}} is placed, {{si|Smite}} can be used to instantly claim the camp. {{tip|Interrupt|Interrupting}} '''Ivern's''' channel is the only way to contest jungle camps, short of killing the camp during the channel time.
* ''Friend of the Forest'' will leave '''Ivern''' at {{as|1 health}} if cast with exactly the required amount. ''Friend of the Forest'' cannot be cast with less, unlike other abilities with health costs.
* The following table refers for interactions while '''Ivern''' is {{tip|channel|channeling}}:
{{ct|channel|cast=interrupts|items=interrupts,true,,false|spells=true,interrupts,interrupts,interrupts,interrupts|interrupts=death, silence|damage=true}}

q1.name: Rootcaller
description: {{sbc|Active:}} '''Ivern''' throws a vine in the target direction, dealing {{as|magic damage}} to the first enemy hit and {{tip|root|rooting}} and {{tip|sight|revealing}} them for a short duration. '''Ivern''' can recast ''Rootcaller'' if it hits a target.

'''Ivern''' and his allies can select the target {{tip|root|rooted}} by ''Rootcaller'' to {{tip|dash}} to their location, with allies stopping at {{sti|their attack range}} and '''Ivern''' stopping at {{sti|range|125 range}} from the target.
q1.descriptionHtml:
Active: Ivern throws a vine in the target direction, dealing magic damage to the first enemy hit and rooting and revealing them for a short duration. Ivern can recast Rootcaller if it hits a target.
Ivern and his allies can select the target rooted by Rootcaller to dash to their location, with allies stopping at their attack range and Ivern stopping at 125 range from the target.
Recast: Ivern dashes to the target.
q1.notes:
* ''Rootcaller'' will hit {{tip|monster|monsters}} but does not deal damage to them unless they were an epic monster.
* '''Ivern's''' pull/attack range is determined when he dashes to the target - not from when he initially casts ''Rootcaller'' and throws the vine.
* '''Ivern''' is not able to dash to the target unless they are within approximately 1200 range.
** {{Pending for test}}: This also counts for allies.
* ''Rootcaller'' {{tt|cannot be used|By either clicking on the target or Ivern recasts}} to {{tip|dash}} while {{tip|ground|grounded}} or {{tip|root|rooted}}. This applies to '''Ivern''' and his allies.
* ''Rootcaller's'' dash does not follow targets, their position at the time of starting the dash is the location '''Ivern''' and his allies will stop from.
* ''Rootcaller'' is always cast from the original casting position.

effects.str:
• Magic Damage: (+ 70% AP)

  • Root Duration:

w1.name: Brushmaker
description: {{sbc|Passive:}} While in {{tip|brush}}, '''Ivern's''' basic attacks deal {{as|'''bonus''' magic damage}}. This bonus persists for 3 seconds after leaving brush.
'''Ivern''' periodically [[stocks]] a ''Brushmaker'' charge, up to a maximum of 3.

{{sbc|Active:}} '''Ivern''' grows a patch of {{tip|brush}} at the target location for 30 seconds, {{tip|sight|revealing}} the area within and around it for 3 seconds. ''Brushmaker'' spawns more brush if used near terrain or other brush.
{{tip|Brush|Brushes}} grown in the line of {{tip|sight}} of enemy {{tip|turret|turrets}} will cause '''Ivern''' and allied units within the brush to be {{tip|expose|exposed}}.
w1.descriptionHtml:
Passive: While in brush, Ivern's basic attacks deal bonus magic damage. This bonus persists for 3 seconds after leaving brush.
Ivern periodically stocks a Brushmaker charge, up to a maximum of 3.
Active: Ivern grows a patch of brush at the target location for 30 seconds, revealing the area within and around it for 3 seconds. Brushmaker spawns more brush if used near terrain or other brush.
Brushes grown in the line of sight of enemy turrets will cause Ivern and allied units within the brush to be exposed.
w1.notes:
* The {{as|'''bonus''' magic damage}} applies to towers.
* The {{as|'''bonus''' magic damage}} can be {{tip|block|blocked}} or {{tip|dodge|dodged}}.
** {{Pending for test}}: Passive's interactions with {{tip|blind|blinding}} effects.
w1.cooldown_warn: Wiki's and Riot's cooldowns do not match: Wiki's value '0' as '0' and riot's value '0.5,0.5,0.5,0.5,0.5' as '0.5'

effects.str: • Bonus Magic Damage: (+ 30% AP)

e1.name: Triggerseed
description: {{sbc|Active:}} '''Ivern''' gifts a ''Triggerseed'' to the target allied champion, himself or {{ui|Daisy}}, {{tip|shielding}} the target for 2 seconds.
At the end of its duration, ''Triggerseed'' bursts, dealing {{as|magic damage}} to all enemies near the target and {{tip|slow|slowing}} them for 2 seconds.
e1.descriptionHtml:
Active: Ivern gifts a Triggerseed to the target allied champion, himself or Daisy, shielding the target for 2 seconds.
At the end of its duration, Triggerseed bursts, dealing magic damage to all enemies near the target and slowing them for 2 seconds.
e1.notes:
* Placing ''Triggerseed'' on allied champions grants them all [[kill]] credits it causes.
* The {{as|magic damage}} benefits from '''Ivern's''' {{sti|{{as|magic penetration}}}}.
** The seed will only trigger '''Ivern's''' [[spell effects]] if it was placed on him or {{ui|Daisy}}.

effects.str:
